input.description: The timeout value is seconds. This is the time after which the command will timeout regardless of whether the command execution is complete or not.

node-name [Optional]: The node name we are looking for.
Valid values: The targeted node-name, or we can use wildcard character "*". Default value: This tag is ignored to be matched while retrieving a node.

domain [Optional]: Specifies the name of the policy domain to which the node belongs.
Valid values: The domain name of targeted node, or we can use wildcard character "*". Default value: This tag is ignored to be matched while retrieving the nodes.

format [Optional]: Specifies how to display the information.
Valid values: Standard, Detailed.
Standard Specifies that partial information is displayed for a node. Detailed Specifies that detailed information is displayed for a node.
Default value: Standard.

type [Optional]: Specifies the type of the node.
Valid values: Client, NAS, Server, Any. Default value: Client.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">find-node-details</xsl:text> </operation-name> <timeout-secs> <xsl:value-of select="'${timeout secs}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </timeout-secs> <command-options> <node-name> <xsl:value-of select="'${node name}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </node-name> <domain> <xsl:value-of select="'${domain}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </domain> <format> <xsl:value-of select="'${format}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </format> <type> <xsl:value-of select="'${type}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </type> </command-options> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: This wrapper generates item xml for - find node details operation.
